events.originalText: After 253 days without an operational government, a second round of investiture votes produced Spain's first coalition government since the Second Republic.
events.subtitle: 2019–2020 Spanish government formation
events.headline: Spain forms first coalition government since Second Republic after 253 days without operational government

events.originalText: A hot air balloon flight from Carterton, New Zealand, collided with a power line while landing, causing it to crash and killing all eleven people on board.
events.subtitle: Hot air balloon
events.headline: Hot air balloon crash in Carterton, New Zealand kills all eleven on board

events.originalText: In Nag Hammadi, Egypt, Muslim gunmen opened fire on a crowd of Coptic Christians leaving church after attending Christmas Liturgy, killing eight of them, as well as one Muslim bystander.
events.subtitle: Nag Hammadi
events.headline: Muslim gunmen kill eight Coptic Christians in Egypt after Christmas Liturgy

events.originalText: The Fourth Republic of Ghana was inaugurated with Jerry Rawlings, the country's former military ruler, as president.
events.subtitle: History of Ghana
events.headline: Jerry Rawlings inaugurated as president of Fourth Republic of Ghana

events.originalText: Representatives of Iranian leader Ruhollah Khomeini delivered a letter to Mikhail Gorbachev, inviting him to consider Islam as an alternative to communism, and predicting the dissolution of the Soviet Bloc.
events.subtitle: Ruhollah Khomeini
events.headline: Iran invites Gorbachev to consider Islam as alternative to communism

events.originalText: The People's Army of Vietnam captured Phnom Penh, marking the end of large-scale fighting in the Cambodian–Vietnamese War.
events.subtitle: People's Army of Vietnam
events.headline: Vietnamese army captures Phnom Penh, ending Cambodian–Vietnamese War

events.originalText: An article entitled "Iran and Red and Black Colonization" was published in the newspaper Ettela'at attacking Ruhollah Khomeini, then in exile in Iraq.
events.subtitle: Iran and Red and Black Colonization
events.headline: Article attacks Ruhollah Khomeini in Iranian newspaper Ettela'at

events.originalText: Marian Anderson became the first African-American to perform with the Metropolitan Opera in New York.
events.subtitle: Marian Anderson
events.headline: Marian Anderson performs with Metropolitan Opera, first African-American to do so

events.originalText: Air National Guard pilot Thomas Mantell, flying in pursuit of an alleged UFO, was killed when his P-51 Mustang crashed near Fort Knox, Kentucky.
events.subtitle: Kentucky Air National Guard
events.headline: Air National Guard pilot killed chasing UFO near Fort Knox, Kentucky

events.originalText: French physicist Marguerite Perey identified francium, the last element to be discovered in nature rather than by synthesis.
events.subtitle: Marguerite Perey
events.headline: Marguerite Perey discovers francium, last element found in nature

events.originalText: Australian aviator Guy Menzies (pictured) flew from Sydney to New Zealand's West Coast, making the first solo trans-Tasman flight.
events.subtitle: Guy Menzies
events.headline: Guy Menzies makes first solo trans-Tasman flight from Sydney to New Zealand

events.originalText: The Marconi International Marine Communication Company specified CQD (audio featured) as the distress signal to be used by its operators.
events.subtitle: Marconi Company
events.headline: Marconi Company specifies CQD as distress signal for operators

events.originalText: The Italian tricolour was first adopted as an official flag by the government of the Cispadane Republic.
events.subtitle: Flag of Italy
events.headline: Italian tricolour adopted as official flag by Cispadane Republic government

events.originalText: The Bank of North America (pictured) opened in Philadelphia as the de facto first central bank of the United States.
events.subtitle: Bank of North America
events.headline: Bank of North America opens in Philadelphia as first central bank of United States

events.originalText: Through his telescope, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei made the first observation of Jupiter's Galilean moons: Io, Europa, Ganymede and Callisto, although he was not able to distinguish the first two until the following night.
events.subtitle: Galileo Galilei
events.headline: Galileo Galilei observes Jupiter's Galilean moons through telescope
